phrases.text: Dô khoan dô khoan dô khoan a hề hò khoan ơ dô khoan

culturalContext.description: This phrase features "hoa" - flower - beauty, youth, transience. Work songs from Central and Southern Vietnam, sung during communal labor.
facts: Hò songs helped coordinate physical labor like rowing boats or pounding rice
Often featured call-and-response between workers to maintain rhythm
Vietnamese folk songs preserve oral traditions passed down through generations without written notation
Dan Tranh (16-string zither) arrangements of folk songs are relatively modern adaptations of vocal traditions
culturalContext.musicalContext: This onomatopoeia phrase contains 13 syllables, longer than typical, allowing for extended melodic development. Onomatopoetic phrases use repeated notes or simple patterns to imitate sounds. Strong rhythmic foundation matching physical work movements.

phrases.text: Hỏi thăm tình thăm cô gái Dô khoan dô khoan dô khoan a hề hò khoan ơ dô khoan thời có chồng chưa hay chưa

culturalContext.description: This phrase features "chồng" - husband - central figure in many complaint songs about marriage difficulties. Work songs from Central and Southern Vietnam, sung during communal labor.
facts: Hò songs helped coordinate physical labor like rowing boats or pounding rice
Often featured call-and-response between workers to maintain rhythm
Wife-complaining-about-husband is a humorous folk song genre expressing women's frustrations within traditional marriage
Vietnamese folk songs preserve oral traditions passed down through generations without written notation
culturalContext.musicalContext: This onomatopoeia phrase contains 25 syllables, longer than typical, allowing for extended melodic development. Onomatopoetic phrases use repeated notes or simple patterns to imitate sounds. Strong rhythmic foundation matching physical work movements.
